name.description: Name of the Country to be searched. By default like query type search is supported where a country can be search by only providing part of the name. If exact match is needed, add exactMatch=true in query parameter.

offset.description: The page number from which the search should continue. Its zero indexed, hence, starts with 0

exactmatch.description: Set to true if exact name match is required. Default value is false

limit.description: The maximum records that can be returned within a page

For creative chicken recipes, I found a recipe called "Chicken curried couscous skillet". It is a quick and healthy recipe that combines chicken breasts with cumin, curry powder, couscous, peas, and raisins. The recipe details include the ingredients, nutrition information, and cooking steps.

As for the available chicken dishes from KFC Chickens API, there are the following options:
1. Peri Peri 10 Strips with Dynamite: 10 spicy Peri Peri chicken strips with Dynamite Spicy Mayo Sauce.
2. Peri Peri 10 Strips with Nashville: 10 spicy Peri Peri chicken strips with Nashville Hot Sauce.
3. Peri Peri 10 Leg pc & 4 dips: 10 spicy Peri Peri leg pieces with 4 dips.
4. Peri Peri 5 Leg Pc Meal: 5 spicy Peri Peri leg pieces, 2 dips, medium fries, and a Pepsi.

Now you can decide which recipe to cook or if you want to order any of the KFC chicken dishes.

answer.final_answer:
Here are some cocktail recipes that contain vodka as one of the ingredients:
1. Bloody Mary: Ingredients - vodka, tomato juice, lemon juice, Worcestershire Sauce, Tabasco sauce, celery salt, black pepper.

And here is a cake recipe from The Birthday Cake DB:
Title: Raspberry and custard muffins
Difficulty: Easy
Portion: Makes 12
Time: Hands-on time 25 min. Oven time 18 min
Description: Reminiscent of school traybakes with pink icing, these raspberry and custard muffins are given a suitably chic update – simply by turning cupcakes upside down. Adding custard to the cake batter creates a moist crumb and another layer of nostalgia, that pairs brilliantly with the raspberry in the jam icing.
Ingredients: unsalted butter, eggs, custard, vanilla bean paste, golden caster sugar, self-raising flour, raspberry jam, icing sugar
Method: Heat the oven, brush melted butter into each hole of the muffin tin, make the cake batter, pour into the tin, bake for 18 minutes, make the icing, and decorate the muffins with icing and sprinkles.

text.example_value: Christmas is one of the most widely celebrated holidays in the world. It is a time of joy, love, and giving, and is traditionally celebrated on December 25th every year. The holiday has its roots in Christianity, where it commemorates the birth of Jesus Christ, but it is now celebrated by people of all religions and cultures.  Christmas is a time when families and friends come together to celebrate and enjoy each other's company. It is a time to share meals, exchange gifts, and participate in various traditions and activities. One of the most beloved traditions of Christmas is decorating a Christmas tree. This tradition originated in Germany and has since spread around the world. Families often decorate their trees with lights, ornaments, and tinsel.  Another beloved tradition is the exchange of gifts. Many people spend weeks or even months searching for the perfect gift for their loved ones. Giving and receiving gifts is a way to show love and appreciation for one another, and it is a way to bring joy to those around us.  Christmas is also a time for giving back to those in need. Many people donate their time, money, or resources to charities and organizations that help those who are less fortunate. This spirit of giving is one of the most important aspects of Christmas and helps to spread love and kindness to those who need it most.  In addition to these traditions, there are many other customs associated with Christmas. These include caroling, baking Christmas cookies, and watching Christmas movies. Each of these traditions brings a unique sense of joy and excitement to the holiday season.  In conclusion, Christmas is a time of joy, love, and giving. It is a time to come together with friends and family and celebrate the holiday season. While the holiday has its roots in Christianity, it is now celebrated by people of all cultures and religions around the world. Christmas traditions bring people together and create memories that will last a lifetime.

next.message:
Based on my search, here are some companies known for their philanthropic activities:

1. TOMS
2. Build-A-Bear
3. Nike
4. Free People
5. ThriftBooks
6. Cotopaxi
7. Ben & Jerry's
8. Google

Now, let's move on to strategies for approaching and convincing potential sponsors to support your cause.

1. Research and Target: Identify companies that align with the values and goals of your charity event. Look for companies that have supported similar causes in the past or have a history of philanthropic activities.

2. Personalized Approach: Tailor your approach to each potential sponsor. Show genuine interest in their company and explain how partnering with your charity event can benefit their brand, reputation, and corporate social responsibility efforts.

3. Value Proposition: Clearly communicate the value and impact of sponsoring your event. Highlight the positive exposure, brand visibility, and goodwill they can generate by supporting a worthy cause.

4. Build Relationships: Focus on building long-term relationships with sponsors rather than just seeking one-time support. Regularly communicate with sponsors, provide updates on the progress and impact of the event, and express gratitude for their contributions.

5. Offer Benefits: Create attractive sponsorship packages that offer tangible benefits to sponsors, such as logo placement, promotional opportunities, and access to networking events or VIP experiences.

6. Show Impact: Provide concrete examples of how their sponsorship can make a difference. Share success stories or testimonials from past events to demonstrate the positive impact that their support can have on the community.

7. Follow-Up: After making an initial pitch, follow up with potential sponsors to address any questions or concerns they may have. Maintain open lines of communication and be responsive to their needs throughout the sponsorship process.

Remember, developing meaningful relationships and showcasing the value of their support are key factors in successfully convincing potential sponsors to contribute to your cause. Good luck with your charity event!

available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "google_search_api", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get search results for Google search keyword query. Customize your results using various parameters"

num.description: Number of results. If empty, defaults to 10

start.description: Defines how many results to skip. You can enter start= in your google URL to check this. For 2nd page of results, you would use start=10. If empty, defaults to 0

html.description: You can choose to get the full page HTML of google page in your result

uule.description: Google's UULE param allows you to specify where the results should be gotten. You have to calculate the UULE yourself and pass it here. We will be adding a location param soon where you can just enter the name of the location and we will calculate UULE our

language.description: Full language name. E.g. English, Italian, Hindi, Spanish, etc

device.description: Either 'desktop' or 'mobile'. Google displays different results based on device so choose the one you care about. If empty, defaults to 'desktop'

Based on the AI Trip Planner's recommendation for a 5-day trip to London, here is an itinerary for your family vacation:

Day 1:
- Arrive in London and check-in to the hotel
- Visit the British Museum
- Take a tour of the Tower of London
- Watch a show at West End

Day 2:
- Visit the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben
- Take a ride on the London Eye
- Explore the Tate Modern museum
- Enjoy dinner at a local pub

Day 3:
- Visit Buckingham Palace and watch the Changing of the Guard ceremony
- Go shopping on Oxford Street
- Visit the National Gallery
- Experience the nightlife in Soho

Day 4:
- Explore the iconic landmarks of London, such as St. Paul's Cathedral and Westminster Abbey
- Take a boat tour on the River Thames
- Discover the historic neighborhood of Covent Garden
- Try local cuisine at Borough Market

Day 5:
- Visit the Tower Bridge and take a walk along the South Bank
- Explore the vibrant Camden Market
- Take a leisurely stroll in Hyde Park
- Enjoy a farewell dinner at a top-rated restaurant

To find information about upcoming flights from your nearest airport to London, I will need to use the Flight API.

answer.final_answer: The current gas price in Iowa is $3.38 for regular, $3.64 for mid-grade, $4.12 for premium, and $3.61 for diesel. The airport in Dallas-Fort Worth (DFW) is located in Grapevine, Texas, United States, and the latitude and longitude are 32.89651945 and -97.0465220537124, respectively. It is situated in Tarrant County and has an elevation of 574 ft. The time zone of DFW is America/Chicago. The airplane with the code '777' is a Boeing 777 (All Series) and can accommodate 281-440 passengers.

- [Website](https://www.dfwairport.com/)

Hope this information is helpful for your vacation planning!

available_tools.name: form_check_user_for_botlibre
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "botlibre", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The form_check_user_for_botlibre API validates user, and returns the user's details."

user.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the user. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private.

application.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

password.description: REQUIRED: The password of the user. A token can also be used.

token.description: REQUIRED: The token of the user. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

available_tools.name: form_check_instance_for_botlibre
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "botlibre", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The form_check_instance_for_botlibre API validates that a bot ID or name exists, and returns the bot's details."

password.description: OPTIONAL: The password of the user. A token can also be used.

is_id.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the bot to validate. The bot's name can also be used, but the ID is better as it is guaranteed to be unique.

name.description: REQUIRED: The nameof the bot to validate. The bot's ID can also be used.

application.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

user.description: OPTIONAL: The ID of the user. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private.

token.description: OPTIONAL: The token of the user. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

available_tools.name: form_chat_for_botlibre
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "botlibre", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The form_chat_for_botlibre API receives a chat message and returns the chat bot's reply as an XML document."

instance.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the bot to chat with. The bot's name can also be used, but the ID is better as it is guaranteed to be unique.

application.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

user.description: OPTIONAL: The ID of the user who is sending the message. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private. The user/password are only required on the first message.

password.description: OPTIONAL: The password of the user who is sending the message. A token can also be used.

token.description: OPTIONAL: The token of the user who is sending the message. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

conversation.description: OPTIONAL: The conversation ID for the current conversation. This must not be passed on the first message, but will be returned by the response, and should be used for all subsequent messages in the conversation.

message.description: OPTIONAL: The chat message to send to the bot. The message can be omitted if you wish the bot to start the conversation (if the bot has a greeting set). The message must be encoded in the URI.

emote.description: OPTIONAL: A emotion to tag the message with. This is one of LOVE, LIKE, DISLIKE, HATE, RAGE, ANGER, CALM, SERENE, ECSTATIC, HAPPY, SAD, CRYING, PANIC, AFRAID, CONFIDENT, COURAGEOUS, SURPRISE, BORED, LAUGHTER, SERIOUS.

correction.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the chat message is a correction to the bot's last answer.

offensive.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the bot's last answer as offensive. The message will be flagged for the bot's administrator to review.

disconnect.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the end of the conversation.

includequestion.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that indicates the question should be included in the response.

Unfortunately, I couldn't provide specific details of recent matchmaking matches in Trackmania. Have a fantastic party!

5314.query: Can you find product offers for Nike shoes with a maximum price of $100? I'm particularly interested in offers with free shipping and returns. Moreover, retrieve the comments for product ID B094NVF2V1.

available_tools.name: search_for_real_time_product_search
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "real_time_product_search", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "search_for_real_time_product_search for product offers - both free-form queries and GTIN/EAN are supported. Each page contains up to 30 product offers. Infinite pagination/scrolling is supported using the *page* parameter."

q.description: Free-form search query or a GTIN/EAN (e.g. *0194252014233*).

store_id.description:
Only return product offers from a specific store. Store IDs can be obtained from the Google Shopping URL after using the **Seller** filter by taking the first part of the `merchagg` variable (until the first *|*) within the `tbs` parameter.

**Example**
af

sort_by.description:
Sort product offers by best match, top rated, lowest or highest price.
Possible values: `BEST_MATCH`, `TOP_RATED`, `LOWEST_PRICE`, `HIGHEST_PRICE`.
Default: `BEST_MATCH`.

max_shipping_days.description: Only return product offers that offer shipping/delivery of up to specific number of days (i.e. shipping speed).

on_sale.description:
Only return product offers that are currently on sale.
Default: `false`.

product_condition.description:
Only return products with a specific condition.
Possible values: `NEW`, `USED`, `REFURBISHED`.

free_shipping.description:
Only return product offers that offer free shipping/delivery.
Default: `false`.

language.description:
The language of the results.
Valid values: see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes
Default: `en`.

country.description:
Country code of the region/country to return offers for.
Valid values: see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2
Default: `us`.

free_returns.description:
Only return product offers that offer free returns.
Default: `false`.

max_price.description: Only return product offers with price lower than a certain value.

min_price.description: Only return product offers with price greater than a certain value.

available_tools.name: product_reviews_for_real_time_product_search
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "real_time_product_search", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get all product reviews. Infinite pagination/scrolling is supported using the *limit* and *offset* parameters."

product_id.description: Product id of the product for which to fetch reviews.

country.description:
Country code of the region/country.
Valid values: see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2
Default: `us`.

language.description:
The language of the results.
Valid values: see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes
Default: `en`.

offset.description:
Number of reviews to skip.
Valid values: integers from 0-30000
Default: `0`.

rating.description:
Only return reviews with user rating greater than the specified value.
Valid values: 1-5.

limit.description:
Maximum number of product reviews to return.
Valid values: integers from 0-100.
Default: `10`.

Default: `us`.

language.description:

Valid values: see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes
Default: `en`.

Here is a list of language codes in ISO 639-1 format:
- Abkhaz (ab)
- Afar (aa)
- Afrikaans (af)
- Akan (ak)
- Albanian (sq)
- Amharic (am)
- Arabic (ar)
- Aragonese (an)
- Armenian (hy)
- Assamese (as)
- Avaric (av)
- Avestan (ae)...and so on. Additionally, Translate it API supports the following languages for translation: English, Arabic, Azerbaijani, Catalan, Chinese, Danish, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Thai, Turkish, Ukrainian, and more.

import json

car_data = [{'city_mpg': 23, 'class': 'compact car', 'combination_mpg': 24, 'cylinders': 4, 'displacement': 1.6, 'drive': 'fwd', 'fuel_type': 'gas', 'highway_mpg': 26, 'make': 'toyota', 'model': 'corolla', 'transmission': 'a', 'year': 1993}, {'city_mpg':...]
filtered_cars = [car for car in car_data if car['combination_mpg'] >= 30 and car['seats'] >= 7]

if len(filtered_cars) == 0:
    filtered_cars = "There are no cars matching your criteria."
else:
    filtered_cars = json.dumps(filtered_cars)

filtered_cars

available_tools.name: reverse_for_locationiq
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "locationiq", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Reverse geocoding is the process of converting a coordinate or location (latitude, longitude) to a readable address or place name. This permits the identification of nearby street addresses, places, and/or area subdivisions such as a neighborhood, county, "

normalizecity.description: Normalizes village to city level data to city

lat.description: Latitude of the location to generate an address for.

format.description: Format to geocode. Only JSON supported for SDKs

lon.description: Longitude of the location to generate an address for.

addressdetails.description: Include a breakdown of the address into elements. Defaults to 1.

accept_language.description: Preferred language order for showing search results, overrides the value specified in the Accept-Language HTTP header. Defaults to en. To use native language for the response when available, use accept-language=native

postaladdress.description: Returns address inside the postaladdress key, that is specifically formatted for each country. Currently supported for addresses in Germany. Defaults to 0 [0,1]

namedetails.description: Include a list of alternative names in the results. These may include language variants, references, operator and brand.

showdistance.description: Returns the straight line distance (meters) between the input location and the result's location. Value is set in the distance key of the response. Defaults to 0 [0,1]

statecode.description: Adds state or province code when available to the statecode key inside the address element. Currently supported for addresses in the USA, Canada and Australia. Defaults to 0

extratags.description: Include additional information in the result if available, e.g. wikipedia link, opening hours.

available_tools.name: nearest_for_locationiq
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "locationiq", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Snaps a coordinate to the street network and returns the nearest n matches. Where coordinates only supports a single {longitude},{latitude} entry."

coordinates.description: String of format {longitude},{latitude};{longitude},{latitude}[;{longitude},{latitude} ...] or polyline({polyline}) or polyline6({polyline6}). polyline follows Google's polyline format with precision 5

exclude.description: Additive list of classes to avoid, order does not matter. input Value - {class}[,{class}] Format - A class name determined by the profile or none.

number.description: Number of nearest segments that should be returned. [ integer >= 1 (default 1) ]

bearings.description:
Limits the search to segments with given bearing in degrees towards true north in clockwise direction. List of positive integer pairs separated by semi-colon and bearings array should be equal to length of coordinate array.
Input Value :- {bearing};{bearin

generate_hints.description: Adds a Hint to the response which can be used in subsequent requests, see hints parameter. Input Value - true (default), false Format - Base64 String

approaches.description: Keep waypoints on curb side. Input Value - {approach};{approach}[;{approach} ...] Format - curb or unrestricted (default)

radiuses.description: Limits the search to given radius in meters Radiuses array length should be same as coordinates array, eaach value separated by semi-colon. Input Value - {radius};{radius}[;{radius} ...] Radius has following format :- double >= 0 or unlimited (default)

To track the calories burned by participants, the calories burned for running cannot be fetched at the moment. However, for cycling, here are the available options:
1. Cycling, <10 mph, leisure bicycling - 290 calories per hour
2. Unicycling - 363 calories per hour
3. Stationary cycling, very light - 217 calories per hour
4. Stationary cycling, light - 399 calories per hour
5. Stationary cycling, moderate - 508 calories per hour
6. Stationary cycling, vigorous - 762 calories per hour
7. Stationary cycling, very vigorous - 908 calories per hour

For the login details of the appointment system API, the username is 'my_username' and the password is 'my_password'.

answer.final_answer:
Bell Helicopter manufactures a model called Bell 206L-3. It has a maximum speed of 130 knots and a cruise speed of 110 knots. The helicopter has a range of 305 nautical miles and a cruise time of 180 minutes. Its fuel capacity is 110 gallons, and it can carry a gross external load of 4250 lbs, with an external load limit of 2000 lbs. The main rotor diameter is 37.0 feet, and it has 2 blades made of metal. The rotor type used is SRT. The helicopter's storage width is 7.333 feet, length is 42.667 feet, and height is 10.5 feet. 

Singapore Airlines operates Airbus A380 aircraft. They have a fleet that includes 17 Airbus A380 aircraft.

next.message:
Bell Helicopter is a renowned manufacturer of helicopters. One of their models is the Bell 206L-3. It has a maximum speed of 130 knots and a cruise speed of 110 knots. The helicopter has a range of 305 nautical miles and a cruise time of 180 minutes. Its fuel capacity is 110 gallons, and it can carry a gross external load of 4250 lbs, with an external load limit of 2000 lbs. The main rotor diameter is 37.0 feet, and it has 2 blades made of metal. The rotor type used is SRT. The helicopter's storage width is 7.333 feet, length is 42.667 feet, and height is 10.5 feet.

As for airlines operating Airbus A380 aircraft, I recommend Singapore Airlines. They have a fleet that includes 17 Airbus A380 aircraft. You can find more information about Singapore Airlines and their fleet [here](https://api-ninjas.com/images/airline_logos/singapore_airlines.jpg).

answer.final_answer: For color combinations, popular choices are Blue and White, Black and Gold, Red and White, Green and Yellow, and Purple and Silver. Commonly used fonts include Helvetica, Montserrat, Lato, Futura, and Roboto. You can find graphic designers or design agencies on platforms like Behance, Dribbble, or Upwork. For creating your own logo, you can try Canva, Adobe Spark, or DesignEvo.

next.message:
Based on the response from the "test_for_underscore_test" function, it seems that the function is not valid at the moment. I apologize for the inconvenience. Since I couldn't retrieve the specific information you requested, let me provide you with some general suggestions:

Popular Color Combinations:
1. Blue and White: Symbolizes trust, professionalism, and reliability.
2. Black and Gold: Represents luxury, elegance, and sophistication.
3. Red and White: Signifies energy, passion, and excitement.
4. Green and Yellow: Portrays freshness, growth, and optimism.
5. Purple and Silver: Represents creativity, royalty, and innovation.

Commonly Used Fonts:
1. Helvetica: Modern, clean, and versatile.
2. Montserrat: Geometric, elegant, and readable.
3. Lato: Friendly, approachable, and legible.
4. Futura: Geometric, minimalistic, and timeless.
5. Roboto: Neutral, versatile, and easily readable.

For graphic designers or design agencies, I recommend conducting a search on platforms such as Behance, Dribbble, or Upwork. These platforms have a wide range of talented designers and agencies that specialize in logo design.

As for online platforms for creating your own logo, I recommend trying Canva, Adobe Spark, or DesignEvo. These platforms provide user-friendly design tools and templates to create professional-looking logos even without design experience.

I hope these suggestions help you in creating your logo for your new business!

message.name: Finish

answer.final_answer: To find car rental companies in Los Angeles that offer affordable rates, I suggest using an online search engine or travel websites. These platforms provide a list of companies, along with reviews and prices, making it easier to compare and choose the best option. As for scenic routes and must-visit destinations, you can consider the Pacific Coast Highway (Highway 1) for breathtaking coastal views, Joshua Tree National Park for desert landscapes, Yosemite National Park for stunning landscapes and waterfalls, Santa Barbara for beautiful beaches and wine tasting, and San Diego for attractions like the San Diego Zoo and Gaslamp Quarter. Remember to check for any travel restrictions or closures before your road trip. Safe travels!

answer.final_answer: For engaging team-building games, you can consider activities like 'Escape Room', 'Outdoor Scavenger Hunt', 'Team Sports Tournaments', or 'Trust-building Exercises' such as the 'Blindfolded Obstacle Course' or 'Minefield'.\n\nAs for dog breeds known for their loyalty and teamwork, examples include the Australian Shepherd, Border Collie, Golden Retriever, Labrador Retriever, and German Shepherd. These breeds can serve as inspiration for developing teamwork and collaboration among your team members.

next.message:
For engaging team-building games, you can consider activities like "Escape Room", "Outdoor Scavenger Hunt", "Team Sports Tournaments", or "Trust-building Exercises" such as the "Blindfolded Obstacle Course" or "Minefield".

As for dog breeds known for their loyalty and teamwork, here are some examples:
1. Australian Shepherd: They are highly intelligent, loyal, and eager to please. They excel in various dog sports and can be great team players.
2. Border Collie: This breed is famous for its exceptional herding abilities. They are highly trainable, loyal, and have a strong desire to work cooperatively.
3. Golden Retriever: Known for their friendly nature, Golden Retrievers are also highly trainable and reliable. They make excellent therapy dogs and are often used in search and rescue operations.
4. Labrador Retriever: Labradors are intelligent, versatile, and have a strong work ethic. They are commonly used as guide dogs, service dogs, and assistance dogs.
5. German Shepherd: Renowned for their loyalty and courage, German Shepherds are frequently employed as police dogs and working dogs. They are highly trainable and protective.

These breeds can serve as inspiration for developing teamwork and collaboration among your team members.

message.name: Finish

age.description: The age of the person in **years**. Required.

gender.description: The gender of the person. Must be either '**male**' or '**female**'. Required.

height.description: The height of the person in **inches**. Required.

available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "health_calculator_api", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The daily_water_intake_for_health_calculator_api Recommendation endpoint calculates the daily recommended water intake based on factors such as weight, activity level, and climate. It provides flexibility by allowing you to specify the unit of measurement "

climate.description:
The climate in which the individual is located.

The climate parameter accepts the following values:
**normal** - Average climate
**hot** - Hot climate
**cold** - Cold climate

activity_level.description:
The activity level of the individual. 

The activity_level parameter accepts the following values:
**sedentary** - Little to no exercise
**lightly_active** - Light exercise/sports 1-3 days/week
**moderately_active** - Moderate exercise/sports 3-5 days/week

weight.description: The weight of the individual in **kilograms (kg)**.

unit.description:
The unit of measurement for the water intake. 
(Default) **ounces**
 Specify **liters** to get the result in liters instead.

available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "health_calculator_api", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "This endpoint calculates the optimal distribution of macronutrients (carbohydrates, proteins, and fats) based on factors such as activity level, body composition goals, and dietary preferences."

activity_level.description:
The activity_level parameter accepts the following values:

**sedentary** - Little to no exercise.
**moderately_active** - Moderate exercise/sports 3-5 days/week.
**very_active** - Hard exercise/sports 6-7 days/week.

body_composition_goal.description:
The body_composition_goal parameter accepts the following values:

**weight_loss** - Goal of losing weight.
**maintenance** - Goal of maintaining current weight.
**muscle_gain** - Goal of gaining muscle.

dietary_preferences.description: The dietary_preferences parameter allows users to specify their dietary preferences. It can be any string value representing the individual's dietary choices or restrictions, such as \"**vegetarian**,\" \"**vegan**,\" \"**pescatarian**,\" or \"**gluten-fre

q.description: Free-form search query or a GTIN/EAN (e.g. *0194252014233*).

store_id.description:
Only return product offers from a specific store. Store IDs can be obtained from the Google Shopping URL after using the **Seller** filter by taking the first part of the `merchagg` variable (until the first *|*) within the `tbs` parameter.

**Example**
af

sort_by.description:
Sort product offers by best match, top rated, lowest or highest price.
Possible values: `BEST_MATCH`, `TOP_RATED`, `LOWEST_PRICE`, `HIGHEST_PRICE`.
Default: `BEST_MATCH`.

max_shipping_days.description: Only return product offers that offer shipping/delivery of up to specific number of days (i.e. shipping speed).

on_sale.description:
Only return product offers that are currently on sale.
Default: `false`.

product_condition.description:
Only return products with a specific condition.
Possible values: `NEW`, `USED`, `REFURBISHED`.

free_shipping.description:
Only return product offers that offer free shipping/delivery.
Default: `false`.

language.description:
The language of the results.
Valid values: see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes
Default: `en`.

country.description:
Country code of the region/country to return offers for.
Valid values: see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2
Default: `us`.

free_returns.description:
Only return product offers that offer free returns.
Default: `false`.

max_price.description: Only return product offers with price lower than a certain value.

min_price.description: Only return product offers with price greater than a certain value.

answer.final_answer:
Here are some delicious recipes for a three-course meal:

1. Appetizer: Caprese Skewers
Ingredients: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella balls, fresh basil leaves, balsamic glaze, olive oil, salt, and pepper.

2. Main Course: Grilled Salmon with Lemon Butter Sauce
Ingredients: Salmon fillets, lemon, butter, garlic cloves, fresh dill, salt, and pepper.

3. Dessert: Chocolate Lava Cake
Ingredients: Dark chocolate, unsalted butter, eggs, sugar, all-purpose flour, salt, and powdered sugar for garnish.

As for the background music playlists, you can search for romantic playlists on music streaming platforms like Spotify, Apple Music, or YouTube. Simply search for keywords like 'romantic dinner playlist' or 'love songs playlist.' Enjoy your romantic dinner at home!

Ingredients: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella balls, fresh basil leaves, balsamic glaze, olive oil, salt, and pepper.

2. Main Course: Grilled Salmon with Lemon Butter Sauce
Ingredients: Salmon fillets, lemon, butter, garlic cloves, fresh dill, salt, and pepper.

3. Dessert: Chocolate Lava Cake
Ingredients: Dark chocolate, unsalted butter, eggs, sugar, all-purpose flour, salt, and powdered sugar for garnish.

As for the background music playlists, you can search for romantic playlists on music streaming platforms like Spotify, Apple Music, or YouTube. Simply search for keywords like 'romantic dinner playlist' or 'love songs playlist.' Enjoy your romantic dinner at home!"
}

Based on the weather forecast for the next few hours, it seems that there will be some clouds with temperatures around 289.75 K. However, it is important to note that this data is only for the next few hours and does not provide a long-term forecast. 

To gather historical weather data for the past five weekends, I can use the "historical_air_pollution_data_for_rapidweather" function. This will give us information about air pollution levels during those weekends, which can help us determine the best activities for the reunion. 

As for outdoor games and decorations, I will need more information about the preferences and the theme of the family reunion. Once I have that information, I can suggest suitable games and decorations for the occasion.

Based on the historical air pollution data for the past five weekends, the air quality has generally been good with an AQI of 1. The levels of pollutants such as CO, NO2, SO2, and PM2.5 have been relatively low during those weekends. This indicates that the air quality is suitable for outdoor activities during the reunion.

For outdoor games, some suggestions could be:
1. Tug of War: Divide the family into two teams and have a friendly competition.
2. Three-Legged Race: Pair up family members and have them race with their legs tied together.
3. Potato Sack Race: Provide potato sacks or large bags for family members to hop race.

As for decorations, you can consider:
1. Outdoor String Lights: Hang string lights around the backyard to create a cozy and festive atmosphere.
2. Balloons and Banners: Use colorful balloons and banners to decorate the designated area for the reunion.
3. Table Centerpieces: Place floral centerpieces or themed decorations on the tables for a nice touch.

Remember to consider the preferences of your family members and the theme of the reunion when finalizing the games and decorations.

62914.query: I am planning to invest in cryptocurrencies and I need to analyze the market trends. Please provide me with the candlestick charts for Bitcoin and Ethereum on Binance with a time interval of 1 day. I would like the charts to cover the last 90 days. Additionally, give me the current stock prices for Google on NASDAQ and the historical stock values for Google on February 1st, 2023.

available_tools.name: binance_charts_for_candlestick_chart
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "candlestick_chart", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "This endpoint creates candlestick charts for any cryptocurrency listed on [Binance](https://www.binance.com) that you want!"

symbol.description:
Symbol for the traiding pair

You can see every traiding pair available [here](https://coinmarketcap.com/en/exchanges/binance)

limit.description:
Amount of candles in the chart

- Default: 16
- Type: Integer. Maximum 1000

interval.description:
Time interval for each candle.

- Default: 1m

## Time intervals
- m: Minutes
- h: Hours
- d: Days
- w: Weeks
- M: Months

List of intervals:
- 1m
- 3m
- 5m
- 15m
- 30m
- 1h
- 2h
- 4h
- 6h
- 8h
- 12h
- 1d
- 3d
- 1w
- 1M

lastprice.description: The last price that the chart must have. This could be useful if there is some delay between your analysis and the call to this API, and that delay could make a difference between the numbers and the chart. If not given, the chart will be created with Bina
